Title: phpDocumentor: Function call injection
Synopsis:
phpDocumentor bundles Smarty which contains an input sanitation
    flaw, allowing attackers to call arbitrary PHP functions.

Background.Text: The phpDocumentor package provides automatic documenting of PHP API directly from the source.

Description.Text: phpDocumentor bundles Smarty with the modifier.regex_replace.php plug-in which does not properly sanitize input related to the ASCII NUL character in a search string.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could call arbitrary PHP functions via templates.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All phpDocumentor users should upgrade to the latest stable version:

NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are
      available since February 12, 2011. It is likely that your system is
      already no longer affected by this issue.
